Well, the official rules for winning Uno are that you get points based on how many cards your opponents are still holding. This means in a multi-round tourney, you can still lose even if you win a round if your opponent scored higher than you--

In official Uno tournaments, you get points based on how many cards your opponents are still holding. In multi-round tourneys, it's important to try and get as many points as you can. So you need to make sure your opponents still have a lot of cards--

You need to be able to do quick maths in your head, and count how many copies of each card have already been played or not. And you need to learn what the optimal plays are when you have a choice in what card you can play next.
